findings.title: Potentially unlimited indemnification
findings.rationale: Indemnity obligations may be uncapped, which can expose you to costs far beyond the contract value.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY Notwithstanding any other provision, Provider's liability is unlimited for indemnification and confidentiality breaches....
findings.context:
hall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Client from all claims, losses, and expenses, without limit.

5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

6. TERM AND TERMINATION

7. CONFIDENTIALITY

findings.title: Broad IP assignment / ownership transfer language
findings.rationale: Assignment language may transfer ownership of work product or IP rather than granting a limited license.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...3. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY All work product created under this Agreement shall be assigned to Client. Provider hereby assigns all right, title, and interest....
findings.exact_snippet: hereby assigns all right, title, and interest

findings.title: Confidentiality may be perpetual / indefinite
findings.rationale: Indefinite confidentiality can create long-term compliance burden and uncertainty around retention and disclosure.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...7. CONFIDENTIALITY Confidentiality obligations are perpetual and survive termination indefinitely....
findings.context:
other provision, Provider's liability is unlimited for indemnification and confidentiality breaches.

6. TERM AND TERMINATION
This Agreement may be terminated by either party with 30 days written notice.

7. CONFIDENTIALITY
Confidentiality obligations are perpetual and survive termination indefinitely.

8. WARRANTIES
Provider provides services on an 'as-is' basis with no express or implied warranties.

9. DISPUTE RESOLUTION
Any disputes shall be resolve

findings.title: Short termination or notice windows
findings.rationale: Short or strict notice windows can lead to accidental renewals or unintended termination.

findings.title: Late fees / high interest
findings.rationale: Penalty terms can increase costs if payment timing slips.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...2. PAYMENT TERMS Client shall pay Provider within 20 days of invoice date. A late fee of 5% applies to overdue amounts....

nd Client Company ("Client").
